t: Zechariah 8
Jerusalem, Holy City of the Future
Again*p the word of the Lord*s of hosts came, saying,
“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘I*pn am zealous for Zion with great zeal; With*ld great fervor I am zealous for her.’

“Thus*p says the Lord:*s ‘I*pn will return to Zion, And*ld dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. Jerusalem*ld shall be called the City of Truth, The*ld Mountain of the Lord*s of hosts, The*ld Holy Mountain.’
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Old*pn men and old women shall again sit In*ld the streets of Jerusalem, Each*ld one with his staff in his hand Because*ld of great age.
The*ld streets of the city Shall*ld be full of boys and girls Playing*ld in its streets.’
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘If*pn it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days, Will*ld it also be marvelous in My eyes?’ Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Behold,*pn I will save My people from the land of the east And*ld from the land of the west;
I*ld will bring them back,*i And*ld they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. They*ld shall be My people And*ld I will be their God, In*ld truth and righteousness.’

“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Let*pn your hands be strong, You*ld who have been hearing in these days These*ld words by the mouth of the prophets, Who*ld spoke*i in the day the foundation was laid For*ld the house of the Lord*s of hosts, That*ld the temple might be built.

For*ld before these days There*ld were no wages for man nor any hire for beast; There*ild was*i no peace from the enemy for whoever went out or came in; For*ld I set all men, everyone, against his neighbor.
But*p now I will*i not treat*i the remnant of this people as in the former days,’ says the Lord*s of hosts.

‘For*pn the seed shall*i be*i prosperous, The*ld vine shall give its fruit, The*ld ground shall give her increase, And*ld the heavens shall give their dew— I*ld will cause the remnant of this people To*ld possess all these.

And*ld it shall come to pass That*ild just as you were a curse among the nations, O*ld house of Judah and house of Israel, So*ld I will save you, and you shall be a blessing. Do*ld not fear, Let*ld your hands be strong.’
“For*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Just*pn as I determined to punish you When*ld your fathers provoked Me to wrath,’ Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, ‘And*ld I would not relent,
So*ld again in these days I*ld am determined to do good To*ld Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Do*ld not fear.
These*ld are*i the things you shall do: Speak*ld each man the truth to his neighbor; Give*ld judgment in your gates for truth, justice, and peace;
Let*ld none of you think evil in your heart against your neighbor; And*ld do not love a false oath. For*ld all these are*i things*i that I hate,’ Says*ld the Lord.”*s
Then*p the word of the Lord*s of hosts came to me, saying,

“Thus says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘The*pn fast of the fourth month,*i The*ld fast of the fifth, The*ld fast of the seventh, And*ld the fast of the tenth, Shall*ld be joy and gladness and cheerful feasts For*ld the house of Judah. Therefore*ld love truth and peace.’
“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘Peoples*pn shall yet come, Inhabitants*ld of many cities;
The*ld inhabitants of one city*i shall go to another, saying, “Let*ld us continue to go and pray before the Lord,*s And*ld seek the Lord*s of hosts. I*ld myself will go also.”
Yes,*ld many peoples and strong nations Shall*ld come to seek the Lord*s of hosts in Jerusalem, And*ld to pray before the Lord.’*s

“Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: ‘In those days ten men from every language of the nations shall grasp the sleeve of a Jewish man, saying, “Let us go with you, for we have heard that*i God is*i with you.”’”
